alert.note: Alert for Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 12:07AM EDT until June 23 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Jenkins and Screven. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millen, Sylvania, Butts, Hiltonia, Rocky Ford, Scarboro, Woodcliff, Emmalane, Perkins, Hilltonia, Altman, Millhaven, Herndon, Jenkins County Hospital, Lincoln State Park, Thomasboro, Parkers, Lawton, Zeigler and Four Points.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
